title: Commercialising Knowledge Assets Fund opens for applications

content.text: Author: Sarah Staniland, Head of Communities and Funding, GOTT
Today, the Government Office for Technology Transfer announced the opening of the autumn call of the new Commercialising Knowledge Assets Fund.
The fund is designed to support government research organisations in accelerating their innovations towards the market.

It will help unlock the commercial potential of a wide range of projects, moving them closer to attracting private sector investment, supporting the government’s growth mission and delivering benefits for citizens.
What is the Commercialising Knowledge Assets Fund?

The Commercialising Knowledge Assets Fund offers funding ranging from £50,000 to £250,000 per project to move viable public sector Knowledge Assets with identified potential markets towards commercialisation.
Successful applicants can also benefit from dedicated project support and expert advice from GOTT teams to help progress their projects.

Funding can be used for a broad spectrum of activities to support your Knowledge Asset commercialisation journey, such as undertaking market and competitor intelligence, user testing or developing an IP strategy.

The  fund is agnostic to the type of Knowledge Asset you’re seeking to commercialise with possible examples ranging from a high-energy X-ray camera contributing to better diagnosis of patients to new tools to measure ground water helping to reduce water scarcity .
The Commercial Readiness Framework
In order to guide and monitor the development of your Knowledge Assets towards commercialisation, we have introduced the Commercial Readiness Framework.
As part of the application process, applicants are asked to map their milestones against the framework. The framework covers four categories:

Using the framework will help guide your approach to commercialisation and project development, ensuring multiple aspects of commercialisation are considered from market strategy to organisational support.
Who can apply?
Funding is available to government Research Organisation, including but not limited to Public Sector Research Establishments (PSREs) and UKRI wholly owned institutes.
Our full eligibility criteria and list of eligible organisations can be found on our About us page.
Why apply?
The Commercialising Knowledge Assets Fund is a unique opportunity for you to scale the impact of your Knowledge Assets.

You will receive the funds and support to progress the commercialisation journey of your Knowledge Asset – for example through licensing, spinouts or joint ventures – thereby realising its value beyond your organisation for the benefit of the UK economy and its citizens.

You’ll have the opportunity to become part of a supportive cross-government community, act as a catalyst for innovation and entrepreneurship in your organisation and help progress the Knowledge Asset agenda across the public sector.
Find out more
Eligible organisations can apply now for the first round of the Commercialising Knowledge Assets Fund which closes on 4th of September 2025.
To find out more, visit our funding page, or contact the team at grantfund.gott@dsit.gov.uk.
We look forward to your application!
